title: Was carrying knives, petrol, chainsaw": Techie Hacks Pregnant Ex-Wife to Death in Hyderabad
description: A gripping story of a tech professional who brutally murdered his pregnant ex-wife using lethal weapons.
content:
#### Background In a shocking incident that has gripped the hearts and minds of residents across India, a software engineer from Hyderabad emerged as the primary suspect in the brutal killing of his pregnant ex-wife. The case has garnered widespread attention due to the alleged use of dangerous weapons such as knives, petrol, and chainsaws to cause grievous harm.

#### Key Developments The story unfolded on July 16th, when a tech professional named Arvind, aged 30, was found dead in his apartment. According to eyewitnesses, he had been carrying several lethal items—knives, petrol, and a chainsaw—to the residence of the deceased woman, who was pregnant at the time.

Arvind’s mother, who lived with him for over two years before the tragic incident, revealed that her son was involved in frequent fights over trivial matters. The couple reportedly had a history of violent domestic disputes, leading to accusations of abuse and mental health issues.

The body found in Arvind's apartment displayed severe injuries—multiple stab wounds, burns caused by petrol fumes, and visible signs of blunt force trauma inflicted with the chainsaw—a gruesome combination that suggests a calculated act of violence intended to murder his pregnant ex-wife as part of an ongoing feud. According to local police sources, they are investigating the case but have not released any further details due to ongoing investigations.

#### Industry Impact This incident has left a deep impression on the tech community in Hyderabad and beyond. It highlights serious concerns regarding domestic violence and mental health in families where technology is a significant aspect of daily life. The use of such lethal instruments by a tech professional has raised questions about the safety protocols for employees handling potentially dangerous equipment at home.

#### Expert Perspective Dr. Priya Sharma, a senior criminologist, stated, "This case raises concerns not just about domestic violence but also about workplace safety and mental health." She added that employers should consider providing better training on how to handle such situations safely or even provide additional support services for employees with known mental health issues.

#### What This Means The murder has sparked a national conversation about the intersection of technology, domestic violence, and mental health. It underscores the need for better policies in workplaces and homes alike that ensure both safety and respect at all times. The incident highlights how easily life-changing decisions can be made by emotions or mental state alone.

#### Looking Ahead As the investigation continues, it remains to be seen whether Arvind’s mother will file a complaint against her son, particularly as she has been living with him for over two years before this tragic event. Whether he was driven by anger at domestic violence or some other psychological factors is yet to be determined but certainly adds layers of complexity to the case.

This story serves as a stark reminder that no matter how high-tech our daily lives might become, mental health issues cannot be ignored—especially when they lead to actions that could end one’s life.
